definition: to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Entrance doors including sliding door and swing doors and ironmongery for the doors.
sentences.chinese: 入口門，包含移門和推拉門，以及門的五金。

sentences.english: Sliding Door, Four Sashes, White Colour, Decoration Bar.
sentences.chinese: 推拉門，四扇推拉，白色噴塗，雙玻含裝飾條。

sentences.english: Sliding Door pulley is part of the core technologies must be carefully chosen.
sentences.chinese: 滑輪是推拉門的核心技術部位，一定要慎重選擇。

sentences.english: Large sliding doors and fixed windows open the major rooms to the garden and courtyards.
sentences.chinese: 大型推拉門和固定窗戶使主要房間敞向花園和庭院。

sentences.english: He gets out, leads me around to the sliding door.
sentences.chinese: 他下了車，帶我走到車子的推拉門那裏。

sentences.english: The urine smell from the security washrooms at the sliding door entrance.
sentences.chinese: 入口處推拉門邊的保安洗手間發出難聞的尿味。

sentences.english: The sliding door flyscreen you advised is exactly what we are needing, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 你建議的推拉門紗窗，正是我們需要的，謝謝你。

definition: head of a flight of stairs
